metadata.titel_preek: Philadelphia: The Keepers Are Kept, Part 1

locutie.beschrijving: Historical context of the seven churches, personal anecdotes about visiting old churches, exegesis of 'little strength' and 'patience', and social commentary on drugs and racial politics in NYC.
locutie.exegetische_kwaliteit: Moderate. The preacher explores the Greek nuances of 'patience' and the dual meaning of 'little strength', but uses the text primarily as a springboard for ethical exhortation.

illocutie.beschrijving: The preacher primarily asserts historical facts and personal memories, then shifts to directing the congregation toward social responsibility and self-reflection.
voorbeelden: I want to talk about 'The Keepers Are Kept'
I want to give you this morning a formula
The meaning may well be thou hast but a little strength

perlocutie.beoogd_effect: To motivate the hearer to use their limited influence for social good and to foster racial/political self-honesty.
perlocutie.pneumatologisch_bewustzijn: Low. The focus is on human effort ('Use it, that's our job') rather than the Spirit's enabling.

voorbeelden: It has become clear to me...
Some years ago I was in Cleveland...
Sardis is a church that is pretending...
You can slip to some pay telephone... and call the police.
I do not know how it is with you, but I would like to have been able to worship...
It was a joy to go into that church...
I am almost embarrassed to say it...
I will get in touch with that police official.
I plan to establish that in a few minutes.
commissieven.kwaliteit: Weak. The promises are mostly human-centered (preacher's promises) rather than Divine promises to the hearer.

declaratieven.autoriteit: Low. The preacher uses the first person to identify with the congregation, but rarely speaks 'in persona Christi' to change the hearer's status.

indicatoren: Detailed historical descriptions of Corinthian problems
Lengthy statistics on the drug trade
constatief_surplus_analyse.effect_op_hoorder: The hearer becomes a spectator of history and social analysis rather than a participant in a divine encounter.

performatief_deficit_analyse.effect_op_hoorder: The hearer is left with a 'to-do list' (Directives) without the 'done' of the Gospel (Commissives/Declaratives).

toezegging_check.kwaliteit_toezeggen: Virtually absent. The 'open door' of the text is discussed as a fact, not offered as a present promise.

eerste_persoon.gebruik: Personal storytelling and establishing ethos ('I was in Cleveland').

tweede_persoon.gebruik: Used for moral exhortation ('You can call the police').
tweede_persoon.performatieve_context: Rarely used for grace; mostly for duty.

derde_persoon.gebruik: Describing the seven churches and the NYC political scene.
derde_persoon.distantie_effect: Strong. It treats the biblical text as a historical object to be analyzed.

tijdloos_present.gebruik: General moral principles ('be hard on yourself').

actueel_present.gebruik: Addressing the current drug and political crisis.

voorbeelden: The drug business has a $65 billion income... We can try to educate our children.
foutief_patroon.probleem: The 'ought' is not grounded in the 'is' of God's grace, but in the 'is' of social crisis.

sacramenteel_patroon.beschrijving: Missing the middle link of the Promise.

voorbeelden_slechte_verhouding: You have but a little strength... Use it, that's our job.

diagnostische_evaluatie.diagnose_toelichting: The sermon functions as a motivational speech. It uses biblical history to set a stage for social and personal improvement, but lacks the performative word of God that actually bestows strength.

sterke_punten.effect: Creates a sense of solidarity between preacher and hearer.

zwakke_punten.probleem: Relies on human willpower rather than the 'kept' promise of the title.

diagnostische_evaluatie.gebeuren_toelichting: It is a lecture/exhortation about strength, not an event where strength is given.
diagnostische_evaluatie.sacramentele_toelichting: The word is used as information, not as a means of grace.

openbaringsleer.god_als_spreker: God is the object of talk, not the subject of the speech act.
openbaringsleer.prediker_als_mandataris: Preacher acts more as a social commentator/coach than a mandatory.
tekstueel_bewijs: I want to give you this morning a formula

pneumatologie.perlocutie_theologie: The effect is attributed to human commitment.
tekstueel_bewijs: until we are all committed to using what little strength we do have.

aanbevelingen.werkwoord_audit_samenvatting: Too many past-tense assertives and second-person imperatives; almost no present-tense commissives.

specifieke_suggesties.huidige_formulering: Thou hast but a little strength. It is true of all of us.
specifieke_suggesties.voorgestelde_revisie: To you who feel your strength failing, Christ says: 'I hold you.'
specifieke_suggesties.verschil: Moves from a general truth to a personal promise.

toezegging_versterking.probleem: The title 'The Keepers are Kept' is never performatively applied.
toezegging_versterking.suggestie: Explicitly declare that God is keeping the hearer.
voorbeeldzinnen: Because you have kept His word, He promises right now to keep you from the hour of trial.

adressering_verbetering.suggestie: Use 'You' in the context of grace, not just duty.
voorbeeldzinnen: This open door is set before YOU.

indicatief_imperatief_herstel.probleem: The imperative 'Use your strength' is not fueled by the indicative of grace.
indicatief_imperatief_herstel.suggestie: Ground the call to action in the finished work of Christ.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: The sermon is rhetorically engaging and socially relevant, but requires a shift from 'talking about' God to 'speaking for' God to become a sacramental event.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_schulz_von_thun: SvT would focus on the preacher's 'self-revelation' about Cleveland; SAT reveals that this self-revelation lacks illocutionary authority.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retoriek: Rhetorically, the anecdotes are excellent; homiletically (SAT), they contribute to constative surplus.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_SAT: SAT exposes that despite the 'we' language, the preacher is not actually 'doing' anything to the hearer other than informing and urging.

kernzinnen_analyse.zin: I want to talk about 'The Keepers Are Kept.'
kernzinnen_analyse.effectiviteit: Low. It frames the sermon as a lecture 'about' a topic.

kernzinnen_analyse.zin: Be hard on yourself and easy on others.
kernzinnen_analyse.effectiviteit: Moderate. Clear moral advice, but lacks Gospel foundation.

appendices.notities: The sermon is Part 1 of a series, which may explain the heavy focus on 'locution' (setting the stage), but the lack of 'illocutionary' grace is a diagnostic concern.
